conclusion: Analyze the direction and path of the liquid as it flows to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid enters from points A, B, C, and D and follows paths indicated by arrows.
Point A's arrow curves downward towards F.
Point B's arrow curves downward towards F.
Point C's arrow continues straight and then curves downward towards F.
Point D's arrow curves downward towards F.
Baffles are placed above containers E and F.
Liquid entering from A, B, C, and D will be guided by baffles to eventually reach container F.
After passing through the baffles, the liquid will not be directed toward container E but will continue towards container F.
The liquid flowing from A, B, C, and D will ultimately flow into container F.
